sub_title: Head of ICT at CJG Rijnmond | Coach & Mentor
summary:
I achieve ambitious IT and organizational goals with my teams and promote a comfortable and safe organizational culture. As Head of ICT I manage at operational, tactical and strategic levels and develop robust IT strategies that benefit the success of the organization.

At renowned companies and organizations such as the Ministry of Defence, Experis Manpower Group, Royal Schiphol Group, ABN-AMRO Bank, Eurailscout Inspection & Analysis B.V. and Ventus, I received and shared a lot of knowledge and experience in the field of IT, business operations and organizational culture. A snapshot of my accumulated knowledge and experience includes:

• Expertise on working and developing various IT infrastructures, ranging from data centers, ERP and CRM systems. Proficient in a broad spectrum of applications.
• Refining work processes using frameworks such as ITIL® and ISO™.
• Managing ICT and security projects of various scales, from modest to complex projects ranging from €200,000 to more than €900 million.
• Developing forward-looking strategies that focus on both organizational and ICT areas in sectors such as defence, aviation, banking, secondment and railways.
• Effective management of departments and Agile teams, including HR tasks;

Driven by my curiosity and perseverance, I obtained a Masters degree (MSc) ICT in Business at Leiden University (2018) and a Bachelors degree (BSc) in Business Informatics (2012). My characteristics also led to following competence-oriented courses, education and training and obtaining various certifications.

Good examples where I learned a lot are a leadership training at the INSEAD Business School in Singapore and courses in Financial Management & FinTech at De Baak and Intuition.com. The certifications I obtained are Agile Professional Scrum Product Owner (PSPO), Lean Six Sigma Green Belt, Prince2® Practitioner and ITIL® IT Service Management Practitioner.

My most valuable and difficult certification to obtain was in 2020 at the Dutch Academy for Psychotherapy where I was prepped to be a Professional Coach within 7 months. Highly recommended for anyone who is open to self-reflection and wants to help people in an effective way.

Feel free to contact me by phone or e-mail if my knowledge and experience can help you further.
I'd love to work with you on your success!

projects.title: Seamless Flow - Biometric passenger journey
projects.description:
Business Analyst for Schiphol Digital Airport Program "Seamless Flow" (May - November 2018)

Contributing to Seamless Flow (a programme that offers passengers a hassle-free experience from enrolment to boarding with the help of biometrics) by collecting and analyzing information & requirements to write the Operational Concept Description for Seamless Flow's stakeholders. 

Other responsibilities are the coordination of several program deliverables such as the design and translation of the Seamless Flow touchpoints for the passengers, writing and rewriting memo's for the board of directors, rewriting Operational Pilot Descriptions and writing detailed work instructions for the airline and ground staff to be executed during the Pilot.

contributors.headline: Head of ICT at CJG Rijnmond | Coach & Mentor

projects.title: Business Intelligence visualization of Change processes
projects.description:
In association with Visionwaves, we converted and visualized the change process of the Supply and Demand organization with the Business Intelligence tool Delta (Graphic Interface for Microsoft's Power BI). 

- Responsible for finding and collaborating with the divisions that managed the data/servers.
- Co-creating a Bizzmap by providing input for User stories.
- Managing the services, clearances, databases and storage needed for the project.
- Cooperating with divisions to obtain the data needed to process them through the ETL's.
- Testing and configuring.

contributors.headline: Head of ICT at CJG Rijnmond | Coach & Mentor

projects.title: Quality Assurance SAP Resources & Finance SPEER
projects.description:
For the Multi-million Euro project SPEER (Strategic Process and Enabled Reengineering), I was responsible for leading the quality assurance for The Royal Netherlands Navy to migrate from Legacy IT systems to SAP Resources & Finance.

The primary goal was to guide each departement to migrate to the ERP tool SAP Resources & Finance by monitoring, informing and helping the departements. The secondary goal was to test and develop Business unit guidelines.

contributors.headline: Head of ICT at CJG Rijnmond | Coach & Mentor

projects.title: Project lead for IT infrastructure and Logistics
projects.description:
Project Leader - IT infrastructure and Logistics

Coordinated three projects for the client; the Ministry of Immigration and Naturalisation Service (IND). The projects involved the deployment of new storage hardware, the migration of data, the separation of data streams and creating a backup and recovery plan. 
Without closing agreements with non-project members and their managers, the projects proved to be challenging.

projects.title: Initiating Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT)
projects.description:
Board member on the council to form a Computer Emergency Response Team.

- Writing a Project Initiation Document on specific security services.
- Reviewing and commenting on documents needed to provide additional security services.
- Advising on strategy to form the CERT and on the general security services of the CERT.

Implementing a new digital workspace and applications for the Dutch Ministry of Immigration and Naturalisation.

• Negotiating and securing agreements with various contacts for our client (IND) and in association with the supplying departments of IVENT; specifically all ITIL-related processes.
• Advising during monthly sessions to improve the business processes of our client.
• Planning the operational changes in absence of the Change coordinator.

profile_positions.title: Senior Manager

profile_positions.description:
Eurailscout Inspection & Analysis B.V. is a mid-sized enterprise with branches in The Netherlands, Germany and France. Eurailscout provides high quality and reliable measurement data retrieved from the measurement systems on our own trains, wagons and from the Ultrasonic equipment used by our handheld crew.

The ICT department, with 24 colleagues in Germany and The Netherlands, develops and manages custom applications used for measurement data. We also provide ICT support for >100 international colleagues. Our expertise includes Digital work places, Consultancy and Image recognition (Computer Vision) using Artificial Intelligence (Deep learning & Machine learning).

•	Responsible for the daily operations of the ICT department, including People management and People planning (I see my colleagues as people, not resources).
•	Accountable for developing and executing the strategies for hardware, applications, data, AI and the ICT department itself.
•	Accountable for the Total ICT budget (Capex & Opex) including current and future investments. This includes office & datacenter ICT (laptops, servers, phones etc.), licenses and the ICT in our measurement trains. 
•	Responsible for ICT service levels and the application portfolio.
•	IT Procurement stakeholder. Member of the Management Team (MT).
•	Reporting to the Chief Technology Officer (CTO).
profile_positions.title: Head of ICT / Senior Manager

profile_positions.description:
Temporary assignment via Experis Manpower Group (formerly known as iSense ICT Professionals).

• Developed the Agile Portfolio Management in the field of Innovation & Technology with stakeholders.
• Enabled global adoption of GCC (Group Change Committee) Agile governance by:
- Delivering & analyzing Requirements for the global programs (Sagas) by interviewing stakeholders;
- Collecting and developing guidelines for project management & workflow management in Jira
• Managing and developing +/- 30 applications including Jira, Aris, Confluence, AWS and AzureDevOps with an international DevOps team (Netherlands & India).
profile_positions.title: Sr. Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Temporary assignment via Experis Manpower Group (formerly known as iSense ICT Professionals).

•	Leading a dedicated Agile team within a Value stream.
•	Managing stakeholders and suppliers. Negotiating and advising on behalf of business owners. 
•	Delivering the business requirements and process changes in all projects of the Value stream.
•	Reviewing / modifying user stories in Jira using the Kanban method.
•	Coaching team members and colleagues.

Other roles I fulfilled:
• Office Champion Schiphol.Works: Guiding the migration of MS Windows 10 and Office 365 Pro.
• Mentor Schiphol Group for the Echo Mentor program: As part of Schiphol’s inclusion and diversity program, I guided mentees with a minority background.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead / Sr. Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Temporary assignment via Experis Manpower Group (formerly known as iSense ICT Professionals).

• Leading a dedicated team for the Value stream Value4Security. In weekly sessions, the team collaborates in an Agile way to deal with challenges of Security-related IT products, services and processes in the following projects: o Renewal of virtual and physical peripheral monitoring;
o Renewal of the Client guidance system for Schiphol’s Badge Center; 
o Digitizing identification cards for issue and intake. 
o Minimal Viable Product for the restricted areas at KLM Catering Services. 
• Identifying and writing business requirements for suppliers (Requests for Information) and management (Requests for Proposals). 
Extra rolls:
• Writing job descriptions, interviewing & assessing candidates for various positions for the Head of Asset and Information Management (AIM).  
• Mentor Schiphol Group for the Echo Mentor program: As part of Schiphol’s inclusion and diversity program, I guided mentees with a minority background. 

• 6 of 6 assignments completed for the following 3 projects within time and budget: 
o Smart Security (2019): Requirements for Deep Learning services to detect baggage. 
o APOC (2019): IT requirements for a new Airport Operations Center. 
o Seamless Flow (2018): Multiple assignments contributing to a biometric service for travellers.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead / Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for day-to-day operations at the JIVC (Joint IT Command) including: 
• Daily collecting and analysing departmental data and KPI’s using Peoplesoft and MS Excel to create reports (weekly, monthly, quarterly). 
• Daily analysing Business unit and Project rapports to find inconsistencies and providing solutions as feedback to Business unit managers and Project leaders. 
• Weekly consulting with the directors of JIVC and Operations to discuss strategy and daily operations based on weekly, monthly and quarterly reports. 
• Weekly consulting with the Change Advisory Board of the JIVC Supply and Demand organization; By analyzing analysis reports with a focus on finances, planning and IT resources, issues were quickly identified and mitigated.
profile_positions.title: Business & Information Analyst - Supply and Demand

profile_positions.description:
By management request, temporarily took the role and responsibilities of Senior Information Analyst at the Control Center of the JIVC Supply and Demand organization. Responsible for day-to-day operations including: 
• Sorting and solving organizational issues including planning, performance, processes and resources. 
• Weekly consulting with the Change Advisory Board of the JIVC Supply and Demand organization using own and team analysis reports with a focus on finances, planning and IT resources. 

Delivered project POC Dashboard within time and budget: 
• Delivery of a dashboard interface for the Control Center based on a "Proof Of Concept" with Business Intelligence supplier VisionWaves. The interface improves the traceability of non-standard IT requests by providing insight to the process flows.
profile_positions.title: Interim Senior Information Analyst - Supply and Demand Management

profile_positions.location: The Hague Area / Den Helder, The Netherlands
profile_positions.title: Managing Consultant ERP (Quality and Project Assurance)

profile_positions.description:
Temporarily accepted the role and responsibilities of Project Leader due to a reorganization. 

Leading 3 projects including coordination tasks for the Ministry of Immigration and Naturalisation Service (IND). The projects involved the deployment of new storage hardware, the migration of data, the separation of data streams and creating a backup and recovery plan. 
o Budget >€ 600 k. 
o Within 6 months, new storage hardware was installed and delivered in working order and agreements were signed with suppliers for the migration of data and the separation of data flows. Project costs remained within budget.
profile_positions.title: Interim Project Leader - IT infrastructure and Logistics

profile_positions.description:
Tasked with implementing an Information Security process on an operational level including formalization. After a year in this position, I temporarily took on a second role as Senior Process Manager due to my supervisor's illness. I executed the following tasks:

• Executive board member in a Security Council focused on forming a Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT). My contributions included advising on the strategy and progress, reviewing security services documents and writing a project initiation document.
• Investigating, evaluating and implementing an organization-wide ITIL information security process at an operational level.
• Providing protocols on how the new information security process impacts the operational and tactical levels of the organization and what benefits it brings.
• Investigating, testing and implementing performance indicators to measure the effectiveness of the information security process on a monthly basis.
profile_positions.title: Process Manager - ITIL Security Management

profile_positions.description:
Temporarily took on the role and responsibilities of Senior Process Manager due to my manager's illness. I was responsible for:

• Leading a Security team of 4 colleagues;
• Advising on personnel and security related projects;
• Maintaining relationships with security-related tactical and operational units and project boards.

Also achieved the following goals:
• Setting up a reintegration process (6 months) for a colleague and successfully coached her without relapse.
• Formalizing and implementing an organization-wide information security process at a tactical level.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead / Interim Senior Process Manager - ITIL Security Management

profile_positions.description:
Temporarily filled the role and responsibilities of Service Manager on the projects W-IND and INDiGO for the Dutch Immigration and Naturalization Service (IND). Responsible for:

• Managing and writing all Dossiers Agreements and Procedures (DAP) for IND projects.
• Researching and creating acceptable norms to use in SLA's (Service Level Agreements).
• Negotiating on SLA agreements with project members of IND and our external suppliers.
• Reviewing operational processes in the organization to maintain our Secured Service Level Agreements in collaboration with other Service Level Managers, Delivery Managers and Senior Process Owners.
profile_positions.title: Interim Service Manager - Immigration and Naturalisation Projects

profile_positions.description:
Due to my experience with a dissatisfied customer, my goal was to professionalize our unit's current incident response process. After a pitch to the management team, I created and fulfilled the role of Incident Coordinator.

Achieved the following improvements within six months:
• Created a communication plan and a redesigned incident process which led to satisfied incident handlers at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and at the Service Desk of the Ministry of Defence.
• Decreased the time per incident with 75% by creating a new role and responsibilities.
• Defined, tested and monitored new performance indicators.
• Documented and transferred the new role description.
profile_positions.title: Incident Coordinator & Tech Support Expert

profile_positions.description:
Promoted due to leadership by igniting the team spirit, reassigning tasks and meeting the set expectations with the team. 

• Leading a team of 4 colleagues and responsible for: 
• Providing technical support for (web)servers, (web)mailservers, relayservers, Anti-virus solutions, E-monitor log services webhosting services and DNET services (part of 24/7 maintenance shifts) in our datacenter. 
• Providing incident support (2nd and 3rd Tier). 
• Administrator of Mail services & Network security for (web)mailservers, relayservers, Anti-virus solutions and DNET dial-in-connections. 
• Subject-matter expert on projects for the Ministry of Internal Affairs (new workplaces), logistics support (EDI) and the migration of the website for the Ministry of Defense.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead IT System Administrators - Mail, Web, Anti-virus

profile_positions.description:
Recruited by Content Staffing and Recruitment (now known as Unique - Staffing and Recruiting) and employed by DTO (IT department and datacenter of the Dutch Ministry of Defence). 

• Managing (web)servers (which include Sun Solaris, Compacq Proliant and HP Proliant), Content Management Systems (Smartsite and TDS) and (web)mailservers in our datacenter. 
• Developing CMS templates with TDS Tridion. 
• Providing Technical support for all CMS, (web)servers and mailservers (part of 24/7 maintenance shifts).
profile_positions.title: IT System Administrator & Tech Support - CMS, E-mail, Webservers
Jr. System developer
